claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Nikola Tesla  (  Никола Тесла 10 July 1856 -- 7 January 1943  )  was a Serbian-American inventor , electrical engineer , mechanical engineer , physicist , and futurist who is best known for his contributions to the design of the modern alternating current  (  AC  )  electricity supply system .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Born and raised in the Austrian Empire , Tesla received an advanced education in engineering and physics in the 1870s and gained practical experience in the early 1880s working in telephony and at Continental Edison in the new electric power industry .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He emigrated to the United States in 1884 , where he would become a naturalized citizen .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He worked for a short time at the Edison Machine Works in New York City before he struck out on his own .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: With the help of partners to finance and market his ideas , Tesla set up laboratories and companies in New York to develop a range of electrical and mechanical devices .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His alternating current  (  AC  )  induction motor and related polyphase AC patents , licensed by Westinghouse Electric in 1888 , earned him a considerable amount of money and became the cornerstone of the polyphase system which that company would eventually market .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Attempting to develop inventions he could patent and market , Tesla conducted a range of experiments with mechanical oscillators/generators , electrical discharge tubes , and early X-ray imaging .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He also built a wireless-controlled boat , one of the first ever exhibited .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Tesla became well known as an inventor and would demonstrate his achievements to celebrities and wealthy patrons at his lab , and was noted for his showmanship at public lectures .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Throughout the 1890s , Tesla would pursue his ideas for wireless lighting and worldwide wireless electric power distribution in his high-voltage , high-frequency power experiments in New York and Colorado Springs .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In 1893 , he made pronouncements on the possibility of wireless communication with his devices .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Tesla tried to put these ideas to practical use in his unfinished Wardenclyffe Tower project , an intercontinental wireless communication and power transmitter , but ran out of funding before he could complete it .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: After Wardenclyffe , Tesla went on to try and develop a series of inventions in the 1910s and 1920s with varying degrees of success .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Having spent most of his money , he lived in a series of New York hotels , leaving behind unpaid bills .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The nature of his earlier work and the pronouncements he made to the press later in life earned him the reputation of an archetypal `` mad scientist '' in American popular culture .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Tesla died in New York City in January 1943 .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His work fell into relative obscurity following his death , but in 1960 , the General Conference on Weights and Measures named the SI unit of magnetic flux density the tesla in his honor .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: There has been a resurgence in popular interest in Tesla since the 1990s .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Among his books are My Inventions : The Autobiography of Nikola Tesla ; The Fantastic Inventions of Nikola Tesla , compiled and edited by David Hatcher Childress ; and The Tesla Papers .

premise_source_doc_sentence: Reproductions of the device are displayed at the Nikola Tesla Museum in Belgrade , the Memorial Centre `` Nikola Tesla '' in Smiljan , the Technical Museum in Zagreb , the Croatian History Museum in Zagreb and in the Ann Arbor Hands-On Museum .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport  (  Аеродром Никола Тесла Београд / Aerodrom Nikola Tesla Beograd  )  , is an international airport serving Belgrade , Serbia .

premise_source_doc_sentence: His long-time interest in Nikola Tesla took root in the early 1950s , and his activities since then have resulted in his recognition as one of the world 's foremost Tesla historians .

claim: Nikola Tesla refused to be a futurist.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His extensive archive on Nikola Tesla and his work , the largest in the United States and second only to that of the Tesla Museum in Belgrade , Yugoslavia , has been acquired by the Historical Society of Western Pennsylvania in Pittsburgh and is now open for public access .
